pr_title: KAFKA-9483; Add Scala KStream#toTable to the Streams DSL

timeline.bodyText:
Sorry to chime in so late on this. I looked at this test before and missed something, which I have just now noticed.
This test inserts an extra operation that defeats the purpose of the test. We should not do groupBy().count(), just the toTable on both streams, followed immediately by the join. The joiner can just concatenate both values and the verification should read the output as a map and ensure the final value is "topic1value1topic2value1".
Adding the groupBy and count results in a repartition and stateful operation, potentially masking a failure to auto-materialize the toTable.
If you like, you can leave this test (there's nothing wrong with it per se) and just add a new test doing what I described.
timeline.author: vvcephei
